title.narrative: Danish-Arab Parthership Programme (DAPP) 2017-2021

description.narrative: Thematic objectives: -Governance standards enhanced by right-holders and duty-bearers -Economic opportunities for young men and women improved

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Enhanced labour market cooperation on matching demand and skills development within Technical Vocational and Educational Training (TVET).
1) In Jordan, a database and programme to match demands with available workforce and to identify needs for skills development has been developed and is in use.

target.value: DRC has matched 1,500 individuals to employment and career development opportunities and is registering company demands for labour for use by social partners.

actual.value: 2,499 referrals in trainings/ job placements and employment related legal referrals since inception. 1,928 beneficiaries in 2021.

target.value: 1) DRC has matched 600 individuals to employment and career development opportunities and is registering company demands for labour for use by social partners.

1) MoUs between the partners and accredited technical training service providers have been signed in Jordan (DRC) Discussions between labour market partners and government/training providers have been initiated.

actual.value: DRC has signed two MoUs under DAPP’s umbrella. Additionally. as a result from discussions between labour market partners and training providers. DRC started referring beneficiaries to vocational trainings.

target.value: 1) DRC has matched 1.500 individuals to employment and career development opportunities and is registering company demands for labour for use by social partners.

title.narrative: Position papers formulated on labour market and socio-economic issues at national and local levels as inputs to advocacy campaigns

Positions and strategies for promotion and improvement of decent work (e.g. minimum wages, social protection, TVET, OHS) and business environment have been developed by the social partners, some of these with support from regional labour market institutions.

target.value: 1) In 2 out of 4 countries. partner organisations (trade unions and employers) is developing position papers on specific issues e.g. OHS. gender. protection of migrant workers. worker’s rights. 2) In 2 out of 4 countries. partner organisations have initiated development of specific lobbying and awareness raising campaign strategies.

actual.value: 1) Took place in 1 country. 2) Took place in 2 countries.

target.value: In 3 out of 4 countries. partner organisations (trade unions and employers organisations) have elaborated and approved at least 8 policies and are implementing lobby and awareness raising campaigns (e.g. OHS. gender. migrant workers rights. workers rights).

In 3 out of 4 countries, partner organisations (trade unions and employers organisations) are implementing issue-based lobbying and awareness raising campaigns (e.g. OHS. gender, migrant workers rights, workers rights).

actual.value: Positions, strategies and studies for promotion and improvement of decent work and business environment have been developed in Tunisia and Morocco.

target.value: 1) 2 trade unions organisations and 1 employers’ organisation are developing research for positions /strategies for concrete improvement of conditions at the labour market.

actual.value: The target for 2018 is partially achieved with a research in Morocco.

target.value: 3 trade unions organisations and 3 employers’ organisations have approved at least 6 policies based on diagnostic studies and have initiated lobbying and awareness raising campaigns (e.g. OHS. gender. migrants worker’s rights).

actual.value: Tunisia) 6 campaigns have begun. Marocco) 3 campaigns have begun. Jordan) 3 campaigns have begun. Egypt) 1 campaign have begun.

title.narrative: Execution of evidence-based advocacy by social partners at all levels to improve labour market legislation and enforcement
Policy positions and proposals are developed and utilized as basis for campaigning and/or (joint) advocacy activities.

target.value: In 3 out of 4 countries, partner organisations (trade unions and employers organisations) are implementing advocacy and lobby campaigns.

actual.value: Advocacy and lobby campaigns implemented/seminars/workshops/trainings held in Tunesia, Jordan and Egypt and are being elaborated in Morocco.

target.value: In 2 out 4 countries. partner organisations (trade unions and employers organisations) have prepared strategies for advocacy and lobbying (e.g. implementation of the social contract in Tunisia. labour law) and have initiate advocacy and lobby campaigns.

actual.value: In Tunisia and Morocco partner organisations have initaited adovcacy and lobby activities.

target.value: Social partners in at least 3 countries have carried out evidence-based advocacy for a total of at least 6 positions/proposals for labour market reform/policy – 20% of these are elaborated jointly or agreed between labour market partners.
In 3 out of 4 countries. partner organisations (trade unions and employers organisations) have developed 6 Position papers and advocacy strategies and prepared strategies for lobby and advocacy.

actual.value: Partner organisations in all four countries have developped position papers (8 in total)

target.value: In 2 out of 4 countries. partner organisations (trade unions and employers organisations) have initiated research as point of departure for evidence based advocacy.

actual.value: The target for 2018 is partially achieved. In one out of planned two countries. partner organisations have initiated research as point of departure for advocacy in the construction sector.

title.narrative: Leaders, negotiators and staff from the social partners are trained and have gained increased knowledge about their role in social dialogue and negotiations

1) Pools of trained internal trainers/resource persons are established and trained in methodology and content to train colleagues/function as resource persons in a variety of labour market issues. 2) 30% of trained trainers/resource persons are women.

target.value: 1). Pools of trainers/resource persons are under development in at least 5 sectors involving training of at least 46 trainers and 720 rank and file workers at enterprise level. 2). At least 600 trade union leaders. shop stewards. activists. employers’ organisation staff members. and management representatives have participated in social dialogue issue-based trainings e.g. CBA training. Basic Trade Union training. ILO standards. OHS. decent work. CSR or TVET.

actual.value: 1) 47 trained in 6 sectors. 2) Achieved.

target.value: 1) At least 600 trade union leaders. shop stewards. activists. employers’ organisation staff members. and management representatives have participated in issue-based trainings e.g. CBA training. Basic Trade Union training. ILO standards. OHS. decent work. CSR or TVET. 2) At least 6 joint labour-management trainings or working sessions.

actual.value:
1) More than 1.800 trade union leaders, shop stewards, activists, employers’ organization staff members, and management representatives have participated in issue-based training against the target of 600.
2) 3 joint labour management trainings were held in Jordan and 2 in Egypt. An OHS training programme for shop stewards and HR-managers were held virtually in Morocco.

target.value: 1). Pools of trainers/resource persons under development in at least 5 sectors involving training of at least 14 trainers. 2). At least 600 trade union leaders. shop stewards. activists. employers’ organisation staff members. and management representatives have participated in social dialogue issue-based trainings e.g. CBA training. Basic Trade Union training. ILO standards. OHS. decent work. CSR or TVET. 3) At least 4 joint labour-management trainings or working sessions.

actual.value:
1). 91 trainers under development and 307 rank and file workers have participated.
2). 1802 people have participated in the social-dialogue training.
3). 6 joint labour-managment training/working sessions were held

target.value: 1). Pools of trainers/resource persons have been established and are active in at least 8 sectors and 100 enterprises. 2) At least 8 joint labour-management trainings or working sessions.

1). Pools of trainers/resource persons are under development in at least 5 sectors involving training of at least 76 and 370 rank and file workers at enterprise level. 2). At least 6506 trade union leaders. shop stewards. activists. employers’ organisation staff members. and management representatives have participated in social dialogue issue-based trainings e.g. CBA training. Basic Trade Union training. ILO standards OHS. decent work. CSR or TVET. 3) At least 3 studies mapping barriers and opportunities for a strengthened role for social partners in social dialogue related issues.

actual.value: The target set for 2018 has been achieved as the consortium is in the process of establishing pools of trained trainers and resource persons in four DAPP countries.

title.narrative: Leaders, negotiators and staff from the social partners are trained in prevention/resolution of disputes at local, sector and national level
Partner Organisations have established pools of resource persons with specific knowledge about mediation and conflict resolution.

target.value: 1) In 3 out of 4 countries, trade union leaders and activists have been trained in conflict resolution. 2) In 2 out of 4 countries. representatives from partner organisations (trade unions and employers) is jointly trained in mediation at national and sectoral level.

actual.value: 1) The development of pools of resource persons with specific knowledge about mediation and conflict resolution is on track in Tunisia and has been initiated in Jordan in 2021. 2) In Tunisia, UTICA trained employer representatives from sector federations and regional offices in mediation in two training sessions. In Jordan, 20 managers and workers from 10 food companies participated in two workshops on current conflict resolution barriers in September and December

target.value: 1) In 2 out of 4 countries. joint follow-up trainings in mediation for representatives from trade unions and employers.
1) In 2 out of 4 countries. partner organisations (trade unions and employers organization) have been trained in conflict resolution.

actual.value: Not fulfilled (only in 1 country) - In Tunisia, 6 trade union leaders from UGTT dept. of studies, and federations of tourism, mining, media and oil & petrochemicals participated in an introductory meeting on Danish experience of mediation and arbitration. 26 representatives from regional member companies, UTICA staff members and the director general of labour inspection participated in a three-day seminar to help regional member companies comply with the laws related to collective dismissals and to conduct social dialogue in the tripartite organ Commission on Control of Dismissals.

target.value: 1) Training materials on conflict resolution developed with inputs from LO/FTF Council and DI. 2) In 1 out of 4 countries. training of trade union representations has been initiated at sector and federation level.

actual.value: The target of 2019 was fully met. Training materials have been developed in Jordan with inputs from DTDA and training of trade union representatives has been initiaed in Tunisia.

target.value: 1) In 1 out of 4 countries. Partner organisations have developed proposal for establishment of a structure for conflict resolution at national and sector level.

actual.value: The target set for 2018 is achieved as the Mediation Fund established in Morocco. Also in Tunisia a proposal has been prepared to support the role of workers representatives in labour courts.

title.narrative: Training materials on social dialogue and key labour market issues is developed and applied by employers and trade unions in selected sectors /enterprises to improve procedures, structures and content of social dialogue
Materials on specific labour market issues/sectors (e.g. occupational safety and health (OSH) are elaborated and used by the social partners.

target.value: 1) Additional 40 trainers/resource persons are engaged in material production groups to develop training materials on specific issues/sectors (e.g. automotive. aeronautic. call-centres. waste-management. agriculture) 2) Training materials in specific issues in 4 sectors is being pilot tested

actual.value: 1) 26 in Tunisia, and 14 in Jordan. 2) 3 training materials in Morocco.

target.value: 1) Training materials in specific issues covering 4 sectors is being pilot tested.
1) Elaborated materials on specific issues/sectors are used by the organisations in a total of 8 sectors in 4 countries.

actual.value: Materials on specific labour market issues have been elaborated and used by social partners in all of the 4 countries and in more than 20 different sectors.

target.value: 1) In 2 out of 4 countries. mapping and/or training needs assessment initiated. 2) Material production groups established and at least 25 trainers/resource persons are engaged in developing training materials on specific issues (e.g. CBA. gender. negotiation) /sectors (e.g. Electricity. petrochemicals. construction).

actual.value: The target set for 2018 is achieved with the completion of two studies (Jordan and Morocco) and development of three sector specific training materials.

title.narrative: Regional initiatives and exchange of experience, including relevant experience from the Danish labour market tradition supporting regional, national and local advocacy.

1) Number of regional policy discussions to which regional evidence-based research, position papers, best practices or tools have contributed. 2) Number of these concerning gender equality 3) Number of national actions inspired by regional/national exchange of experience concerning decent work and business environment.

target.value: 1) Regional evidence-based research. position papers. best practices and tools are developed and have contributed to at least five national/regional policy discussions or local project initiatives. 2) At least two of these concern gender /youth equality 3) Regional media network is pursuing documentation/stories on labour market issues in accordance with media strategy.

actual.value: 1) Fulfilled and contributed to 6 national policy discussions 2) 6 of them will also discuss gender/youth equality 3) The media meeting was changed to a study on the impact of covid 19

target.value: 1) Regional evidence-based research, position papers, best practices and tools are developed and have contributed to at least five national/regional policy discussions or local project initiatives.?? 2) At least two of these concern gender /youth equalities?? 3). Regional media network is pursuing documentation/stories on labour market issues in accordance with media strategy.?

actual.value: 1) In Jordan, JCI has developed an Industrial Priority Plan with 54 recommendations to improve the business eco-system. Several meetings with politicians and opinion leaders have been held including, Royal Court, Ministry of Trade and Industry, Prime Minister. 2) At regional level, GBV campaign materials (Posters, flyers and booklets/folders) were developed, printed and used as supporting documents in 7 local campaigns in 6 MENA countries by the 15 women trade union leaders representing the women/gender committees. 3) 45 resource persons from trade union organisations members of the ATUC media network across MENA participated in the annual meeting. In 2021, the network produced: 1) Role of Media Network on Promoting SDG’s. 2) Trade union Dictionary.

target.value: 1) At least two regional studies on specific issues e.g. mapping of existing CBAs. employment. labour market flexibility. productivity. decent work. CSR or other key issues in the labour market has been initiated and at least two regional network meetings have been executed. 2) At least one of these concerns gender / youth equality. 3) Regional media strategy developed to support regional media network in pursuing documentation/stories on labour market issues.

actual.value: The targets set for 2018 is achieved. Planned regional studies have been conducted and planned network meetings have taken place. Two network meetings has focused specifically on gender equality. Also the media strategy has been developed.

title.narrative: Labour market legislation and enforcement improved through partnerships
Increase in number of countries with policy reforms addressing labour market legislation and enforcement with partner involvement.

target.value: 1) 2 out of 4 countries have developed reforms of the labour market legislation or its enforcement due to engagement of the partner organisations 2) In 2 out of 4 countries. a Memorandum of Understanding is signed by network/alliance partners for (joint) advocacy to improve labour market legislation and enforcement.

title.narrative: Cooperation between social partners and other labour market stakeholders improved through partnerships.
Increase in number of registered Collective Bargaining Agreements (CBA) and other bipartite agreements with partner involvement.
Advocacy and lobbying improved through partnerships

Increase in partner organisations’ advocacy and campaigns for policy positions and proposals developed by trade unions and employers to promote policies conducive for decent work (e.g. minimum wages, social protection, TVET, OHS) and business environment.

target.value: Advocacy and campaigns conducted by partner organisations in 3 countries can be traced in national and local media.

title.narrative: Conflict resolution and prevention improved through partnerships
Proposals /initiatives are discussed among the social partners to establish or improve functioning of social dialogue structures.

target.value: In 2 out of 4 countries. proposals are discussed by the social partners in order to establish social dialogue structures.
